frameDefinitions: This frame has to do with the repetition (and especially the frequency of repetition) of an event.
Two parties, the Exchangers, each give and receive from the other Themes.
An Experiencer feels an emotion as evoked as an Other.
A Proprietor owns or runs a Business which provides a Product (which may be goods or services).
This frame contains words that describe a set of individuals which possess some Commonality, generally a common attribute.
Two or more distinct entities, which may be concrete or abstract objects or types, are characterized as being similar to each other.
frameExamples: China will have to face a high <t>frequency</t> of sand storms in the years to come.
They <t>swapped</t> the island with the Neapolitan government of the day for the much smaller Capri.
One might <t>pity</t> the frail old man in East Berlin.
The consumer electronics <t>company</t> Apple has exploded with popularity in recent years.

A mulberry is very <t>similar</t> in shape
to a loganberry
listRoleDefinitions: This role is used for any (bounded) <fen>Event</fen> whose frequency or iteration is described.
The extent to which the actually observed rate of occurrence of the <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> differs from the expected rate.
The <fen>Interval</fen> is a noun modified by the target word. The target word specifies the frequency of the <fen>Interval</fen> .
The <fen>Time_span</fen> is the length of time of the <fen>Interval</fen>. This role is incorporated by most of the lexical units in this frame.
The number of times per unit of real or scanning time that an <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is encountered.
An entity which the implicit cognizer encounters with the specified frequency.
The frequency feature of the <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is under discussion. All the lexical units in this frame incorporate this frame element.
The Time when the Event has a particular frequency.

In cases where the <fen>Exchangers</fen> involved in a conversation are
construed as two separate groups with different levels of
volitionality or control, this role identifies the conversational
participant with greater semantic and syntactic prominence, as
compared with <fen>Exchanger_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Exchanger_1</fen> is generally
encoded as Subject, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference
to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Exchanger_1</fen>. Thus
a <fen>Purpose</fen> (or <fen>Means</fen>, <fen>Depictive</fen>, or <fen>Manner</fen>) is construed to be that
of <fen>Exchanger_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Exchanger_2</fen> or the group
of <fen>Exchangers</fen> as a whole.

In cases where the <fen>Exchangers</fen> involved in a conversation are
construed as two separate groups with different levels of
volitionality or control, <fen>Exchanger_2</fen> refers to the semantically
and grammatically less prominent group. It is generally encoded
within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with). Note that it
is possible for a single role to correspond to multiple referents.
For example, if the prepositional object in the example below were
plural, we would still assign it the single role <fen>Exchanger_2</fen>.

In some sentences both participants are expressed by the Subject, and there is no 'with'-phrase (cf example 1). In sentences like this, the Subject is assigned the role role <fen>Exchangers</fen>. In such sentences, the Subject always denotes more than one person, and it is understood that the reciprocal communication takes place between these two (or more) people. The Subject may denote two or more people either through conjunction, as in example 1, or through plurality, as in example 2, or by denoting a group, as in example 3. In each of these cases the role <fen>Exchangers</fen> is assigned. Notice that for nouns in the Exchange frame, it is possible for the <fen>Exchangers</fen> role to be expressed by a prepositional phrase as in example 4.
The item that begins in the possession of <fen>Exchanger_1</fen>.
The item that begins in the possession of <fen>Exchanger_2</fen>.
The items which change possession between the <fen>Exchangers</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the exchange takes place.
This role identifies the place where the exchange occurs.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Other</fen> is the person that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The  <fen>Situation</fen> is the circumstances or topic about which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels an emotion.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels for the <fen>Other</fen>.
<fen>Business</fen> identifies the company or establishment. This may be the target itself or the <fen>Business_Name</fen> if it is an appositive not set off with commas (i.e. restrictive):
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> in which the business is located.

This role denotes the people in possession of the Commonality. This role is usually genetive, the object of a postnominal PP, or null instantiated (INI), and null instantiaton often implies the public at large, as in 'the common good'.
This role denotes an object or attribute which is jointly posessed by the <fen>Entities</fen>.
One of the possesors of the <fen>Commonality</fen>. Can be singular or plural.
One of the possesors of the <fen>Commonality</fen>. Can be singular or plural.
This role marks constituents that express the set of objects or types whose similarity is at issue.

When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the entity characterized by its similarity to <fen>Entity_2</fen>, whose characteristics are assumed to be known.  <fen>Entity_1</fen> is often an external argument.

When the <fen>Entities</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Entity_2</fen> is the one whose characteristics are assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing characteristics of <fen>Entity_1</fen>.
This role marks constituents which express a property in respect to which the similarity of the entities is assessed.
A fact about <fen>Entity_1</fen> or the <fen>Entities</fen> that reveals how <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the same or different from other entities.  (Note the contrast with 'as to'.)
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the similarity occurs or exists.
The Place is the general area in which similarity occurs or exists
listRoleExamples: The country has been struck by frequent <fex>economic crises</fex>.
The Crested Lark (Galerida cristata) is  <fex>very</fex> frequent from the coastal plain to the mountains.
The meetings occurred at fortnightly <fex>intervals</fex>.
You have to renew the license every <fex>year</fex> .
The state government spends its fiscal year 2006 budget of $23.4 billion at a rate <fex>of $742 per second</fex>.
It costs about US$2.50 to travel 200km (124 mi), but <fex>buses</fex> are infrequent and only one or two buses a day service most routes.
These exposures were likely to be intermittent <fex>in frequency</fex> occurring only when workers were participating in activities at these specific areas.
The trade <fex>with Cuba</fex> went exactly as planned.
<fex>Smithers and Kornfeldt</fex> traded Pez dispensers.
I tucked the pistol between my belt and tunic top (how I wish I had kept it, but I later swapped <fex>it</fex> with a Canadian for some cigarettes.
The organization bought the property in 1999, then swapped it with the BLM <fex>for about 100 parcels in 10 counties ranging in size from one to 920 acres</fex>.
They swapped <fex>guitars</fex>.
The electronics <fex><t>firm</t></fex> went bankrupt.
Chris's business <fex>in Idaho</fex> is thriving.
<fex>Their</fex> common enemy was Britain.
Their shared <fex>parents</fex> were their only similarity.
<fex>He</fex> shares a home with us.
He shares a home with <fex>us</fex>.
<fex>The two painters</fex> were alike in being unable to draw acceptably .
In the first phase <fex>Barthes's approach</fex> has similarities to that of Levi-Strauss.
The results of Method 2 show remarkable similarity <fex>to those obtained by Method 1</fex>
The disc announced Friday is <fex>physically</fex> similar to current music CDs
His presidency was different <fex>in that it offered a way forward for the common man</fex> .
